KH.content: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra
KH.linkedContent: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra

KH.content: risk of feminizing khōra, a female proper name?
khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it
KH.linkedContent: khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it

KH.content: khōra possesses all she receives but not as properties
KH.linkedContent: khōra possesses all she receives but not as properties

KH.content: guardians of city have nothing of their own just like khōra? the city takes all measures so no parent can recognize their own (child) > a site where law of proper no longer has meaning
KH.linkedContent: guardians of city have nothing of their own just like khōra? the city takes all measures so no parent can recognize their own (child) > a site where law of proper no longer has meaning

GT.content: logic of gift under the regime of to have, to be?give what one possess or what one doesn’t possess?
GT.linkedContent: logic of gift under the regime of to have, to be?give what one possess or what one doesn’t possess?

MONL.content: master does not have exclusive possession of anything, only possesses, usurps unnaturally, rapes, colonizes through “unnatural process of politico-phantasmatic constructions”
MONL.linkedContent: master does not have exclusive possession of anything, only possesses, usurps unnaturally, rapes, colonizes through “unnatural process of politico-phantasmatic constructions”

MONL.content: monolingual solipsism never belonging, property, power of mastery, pure “ipseity” (hospitality or hostility)
MONL.linkedContent: monolingual solipsism never belonging, property, power of mastery, pure “ipseity” (hospitality or hostility)

MONL.content: no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]
MONL.linkedContent: no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]

R.content: democracy defined by lack of the proper and the selfsame (affirms and defies the proper)
R.linkedContent: democracy defined by lack of the proper and the selfsame (affirms and defies the proper)

FK.content: religion appropriates indemnification of all “proper,” all property: the letter, blood and soil, family, nation.
FK.linkedContent: religion appropriates indemnification of all “proper,” all property: the letter, blood and soil, family, nation.

FK.content: w/ Kant, self-sacrifice sacrifices most proper in service of most proper
FK.linkedContent: w/ Kant, self-sacrifice sacrifices most proper in service of most proper

H.content: inviolable immunity (the home) remains the condition of hospitality
H.linkedContent: inviolable immunity (the home) remains the condition of hospitality

H.content: “what constitutes a space of controlled and circumscribed property is just what opens it to intrusion,” monad of a home has to have windows, has to let in
H.linkedContent: “what constitutes a space of controlled and circumscribed property is just what opens it to intrusion,” monad of a home has to have windows, has to let in

AF.content: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]
AF.linkedContent: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]

SPOM.content: money, spectralizing disincarnation, not lifeless body, but life w/out individual property, general property of money deprives all personal property (Eigentümlichkeit) of difference
SPOM.linkedContent: money, spectralizing disincarnation, not lifeless body, but life w/out individual property, general property of money deprives all personal property (Eigentümlichkeit) of difference

SPOM.content: Shakespeare understood this phantomalization of property > Marx: little connection btwn money, general form of property, and personal peculiarity (persönlichen Eigentümlichkeit)
SPOM.linkedContent: Shakespeare understood this phantomalization of property > Marx: little connection btwn money, general form of property, and personal peculiarity (persönlichen Eigentümlichkeit)

SPOM.content: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne
SPOM.linkedContent: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne

SPOM.content: when Marx describes anachronistic dislocation (“there the words (Phrase) went beyond the content (Inhalt); here the content goes beyond the words”), he believes in the proper content, appropriate content
SPOM.linkedContent: when Marx describes anachronistic dislocation (“there the words (Phrase) went beyond the content (Inhalt); here the content goes beyond the words”), he believes in the proper content, appropriate content

SPOM.content: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)

SPOM.content: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body
SPOM.linkedContent: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body

SPOM.content: to be done with ghost, to have it, to identify it, to situate it, see it, possess w/out being possessed, but to possess a specter, is that not to be possessed? [Stirner and Marx disagree over best way to put ghosts to death, same end—different means?] [Die Besessenen]
SPOM.linkedContent: to be done with ghost, to have it, to identify it, to situate it, see it, possess w/out being possessed, but to possess a specter, is that not to be possessed? [Stirner and Marx disagree over best way to put ghosts to death, same end—different means?] [Die Besessenen]

SPOM.content: phenomenological good sense “may perhaps be valid” for use-value, or only for use-value, phenomenology of good sense, of perception (at work in Marx), of Enlightenment, has nothing mysterious about it, use-value as the proper of man
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological good sense “may perhaps be valid” for use-value, or only for use-value, phenomenology of good sense, of perception (at work in Marx), of Enlightenment, has nothing mysterious about it, use-value as the proper of man

HERP.content: friend has no face, no figure, no sex, at a distance neither absolutely infinite, nor absolute proximity (null) of an ownness (propriété) [see p. 70]
HERP.linkedContent: friend has no face, no figure, no sex, at a distance neither absolutely infinite, nor absolute proximity (null) of an ownness (propriété) [see p. 70]

HERP.content: “philia ist das Gönne der Gunst,” philia is the other’s proper, gift to the other of what is to the other its own proper
HERP.linkedContent: “philia ist das Gönne der Gunst,” philia is the other’s proper, gift to the other of what is to the other its own proper

MSUBJ.content: “the property of a theme is what an expropriation has deprived us, and it is as if we had been deprived of our own memory, distanced from our own birth”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: “the property of a theme is what an expropriation has deprived us, and it is as if we had been deprived of our own memory, distanced from our own birth”

A.content: proper of our existence belongs as much to us as we belong to it [double possession]
A.linkedContent: proper of our existence belongs as much to us as we belong to it [double possession]

A.content: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time
A.linkedContent: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time

A.content: jealousy: primitive passion for the proper, for proper possibility re: one’s existence
A.linkedContent: jealousy: primitive passion for the proper, for proper possibility re: one’s existence

A.content: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

A.content: “if being-possible is the being proper to Dasein, then the existential analysis of the death of Dasein will have to make of this possibility its theme”
A.linkedContent: “if being-possible is the being proper to Dasein, then the existential analysis of the death of Dasein will have to make of this possibility its theme”

A.content: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]

A.content: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis
A.linkedContent: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis

EM.content: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)
EM.linkedContent: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)

EM.content: though Dasein not simply man of metaphysics, everything in Letter on Humanism and beyond returns to “proper of man,” guided by concept of proximity
EM.linkedContent: though Dasein not simply man of metaphysics, everything in Letter on Humanism and beyond returns to “proper of man,” guided by concept of proximity

EM.content: for Heidegger, “le proche, c’est le propre; le propre, c’est le plus proche (prope, proprius), l’homme est le proper de l’être, qui de tout près lui parle à l’oreille”
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, “le proche, c’est le propre; le propre, c’est le plus proche (prope, proprius), l’homme est le proper de l’être, qui de tout près lui parle à l’oreille”

EM.content: (161) isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]
EM.linkedContent: (161) isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]

EM.content: prescription of the end of man, prescribed since always, has done nothing but “modulate equivocality of the end, in the play of telos and death”
EM.linkedContent: prescription of the end of man, prescribed since always, has done nothing but “modulate equivocality of the end, in the play of telos and death”

EM.content: dans la lecture de ce jeu: le fin de l’homme est la pensée de l’être, l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être, la fin de l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être > l’homme est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-a-dire la fin de son propre > l’être est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-à-dire la fin de son propre
EM.linkedContent: dans la lecture de ce jeu: le fin de l’homme est la pensée de l’être, l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être, la fin de l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être > l’homme est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-a-dire la fin de son propre > l’être est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-à-dire la fin de son propre

SEC.content: Derrida will differentiate writing from a concept of communication which would treat the nonsemantic (gestures, tremors, shocks) as proper or primitive meaning
SEC.linkedContent: Derrida will differentiate writing from a concept of communication which would treat the nonsemantic (gestures, tremors, shocks) as proper or primitive meaning

PP.content: mimicry of Thoth prevents dialectics, an ironic doubling preventing fulfillment or eschatological reappropriation, he is never present, he invented play, his propriety is impropriety
PP.linkedContent: mimicry of Thoth prevents dialectics, an ironic doubling preventing fulfillment or eschatological reappropriation, he is never present, he invented play, his propriety is impropriety

PP.content: pharmakon is possession and the cure for possession

VM.content: Levinas: “to possess, to know, to grasp are all synonyms of power”
VM.linkedContent: Levinas: “to possess, to know, to grasp are all synonyms of power”

VM.content: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)

VM.content: in this language, our only language, how can we not repeat Hegelianism > this language coming into absolute possession of itself?
VM.linkedContent: in this language, our only language, how can we not repeat Hegelianism > this language coming into absolute possession of itself?

VP.content: proper (Eigenheit) as monad fissured in what we call time
VP.linkedContent: proper (Eigenheit) as monad fissured in what we call time

OH.content: whether hospitable or xenophobic, self-affirmation of identity always claims to be responding to call of universality, an inscription of universal in singular, unique testimony to human essence and to what’s proper to man
OH.linkedContent: whether hospitable or xenophobic, self-affirmation of identity always claims to be responding to call of universality, an inscription of universal in singular, unique testimony to human essence and to what’s proper to man

T.content: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper
T.linkedContent: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper

POOF.content: for Cicero, 2 types of friendship: ‘true & perfect’ vs. ‘vulgar & mediocre’ > friendship is rare, requires selection, classically associated w/ familiarity, proximity, oikeiótēs: such logic extends into all political models of res publica
POOF.linkedContent: for Cicero, 2 types of friendship: ‘true & perfect’ vs. ‘vulgar & mediocre’ > friendship is rare, requires selection, classically associated w/ familiarity, proximity, oikeiótēs: such logic extends into all political models of res publica

POOF.content: Nietzsche on ‘love’ denounces the right to property, love of thy neighbor as desire for more possessions, ‘love’ is the cupidity of possessing > ‘love btwn the sexes’ is egotism itself, jealousy that tends only toward possession (Besitzen)
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche on ‘love’ denounces the right to property, love of thy neighbor as desire for more possessions, ‘love’ is the cupidity of possessing > ‘love btwn the sexes’ is egotism itself, jealousy that tends only toward possession (Besitzen)

POOF.content: Nietzsche contesting Christian revolution of love: neighbor’s proximity as the ruse of proper & appropriation
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche contesting Christian revolution of love: neighbor’s proximity as the ruse of proper & appropriation

POOF.content: Nietzsche advocates another love, a love more loving than love, whose ‘just name’ would be friendship
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche advocates another love, a love more loving than love, whose ‘just name’ would be friendship

POOF.content: following Nietzsche beyond Eros? if love is always a lust for new possession, we must acquiesce to principle of ruin at heart of utterly new > would this leave open the chance to accord w/ the “love whose just name would be friendship” [?]—just once, it would happen, friendship as the name for this impossible event [only once btwn 2]
POOF.linkedContent: following Nietzsche beyond Eros? if love is always a lust for new possession, we must acquiesce to principle of ruin at heart of utterly new > would this leave open the chance to accord w/ the “love whose just name would be friendship” [?]—just once, it would happen, friendship as the name for this impossible event [only once btwn 2]

POOF.content: Benveniste’s etymology of phílos, its relation to home, hospitality & oath, but in Homer phílos has vague possessive quality (‘his knees,’ ‘his son’)
POOF.linkedContent: Benveniste’s etymology of phílos, its relation to home, hospitality & oath, but in Homer phílos has vague possessive quality (‘his knees,’ ‘his son’)

POOF.content: suitability (covenance) of the enemy, lodged w/in oikeiéotēs, my own projection, an exemplarity more real/resistant than my own shadow, my truth in painting > proof in the fact that I can address him, call to him, he becomes origin/destination of call [to the point of madness]
POOF.linkedContent: suitability (covenance) of the enemy, lodged w/in oikeiéotēs, my own projection, an exemplarity more real/resistant than my own shadow, my truth in painting > proof in the fact that I can address him, call to him, he becomes origin/destination of call [to the point of madness]

POOF.content: via Kant's suspicion of tenderness/gentleness in friendship, a catastrophic complication in natural law of attraction/repulsion, a rupture, love will tend toward the evil of reciprocal possession (fusion), love harbors hate w/in itself > friendship as sign/symptom of this possible perversion, and that which protects us from it: attraction must be against attraction, repulsion against repulsion
POOF.linkedContent: via Kant's suspicion of tenderness/gentleness in friendship, a catastrophic complication in natural law of attraction/repulsion, a rupture, love will tend toward the evil of reciprocal possession (fusion), love harbors hate w/in itself > friendship as sign/symptom of this possible perversion, and that which protects us from it: attraction must be against attraction, repulsion against repulsion

POOF.content: if no appurtenance in friendship, why call this foreigner (absolute foreigner) my friend? no appeasing response to this question
POOF.linkedContent: if no appurtenance in friendship, why call this foreigner (absolute foreigner) my friend? no appeasing response to this question

PPHS.content: Hegel: idea is in full possession of itself while it is [its] other
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: idea is in full possession of itself while it is [its] other

PPHS.content: possession of pit > gives forth its property, produces light
PPHS.linkedContent: possession of pit > gives forth its property, produces light

FWT.content: “proper of man”: none of the traits believed to be man’s alone are man’s alone > either an animal possesses them, or man does not possess them as surely as is believed
FWT.linkedContent: “proper of man”: none of the traits believed to be man’s alone are man’s alone > either an animal possesses them, or man does not possess them as surely as is believed

FWT.content: work is always work of mourning, internalizes, appropriating idealization
FWT.linkedContent: work is always work of mourning, internalizes, appropriating idealization

FWT.content: what welds philosophy as ontology (in its hegemonic tradition) to political theology of DP, & to idea of “proper to man”: 1) Plato’s care for death (epimeleia tou thanatou) 2) Kant’s dignity (Würde), man as end in himself, inscribes DP w/in his law 3) Hegel’s struggle for recognition 4) Heidegger’s being-toward-death of Dasein
FWT.linkedContent: what welds philosophy as ontology (in its hegemonic tradition) to political theology of DP, & to idea of “proper to man”: 1) Plato’s care for death (epimeleia tou thanatou) 2) Kant’s dignity (Würde), man as end in himself, inscribes DP w/in his law 3) Hegel’s struggle for recognition 4) Heidegger’s being-toward-death of Dasein

FWT.content: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas
FWT.linkedContent: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas

WM.content: Marx against etymologism (like Rousseau, Leibniz, Plato), rails against Stirner, who refutes communist abolition of property via etymology: essential “having” in Eigentum (property)
WM.linkedContent: Marx against etymologism (like Rousseau, Leibniz, Plato), rails against Stirner, who refutes communist abolition of property via etymology: essential “having” in Eigentum (property)

WM.content: Derrida distinguishes btwn Aristotle's kurion and idion, both generally translated as proper > generally, properness is exterior to form (metaphorical or not) of discourse, but not the case w/ kurion and idion [a properness of language]; accident is not proper to a thing’s essence
WM.linkedContent: Derrida distinguishes btwn Aristotle's kurion and idion, both generally translated as proper > generally, properness is exterior to form (metaphorical or not) of discourse, but not the case w/ kurion and idion [a properness of language]; accident is not proper to a thing’s essence

WM.content: no philosophy has renounced Aristotelian ideal that a noun, to be proper, must have one single sense, telos of language must be able to master and analyze polysemia w/ no remainder
WM.linkedContent: no philosophy has renounced Aristotelian ideal that a noun, to be proper, must have one single sense, telos of language must be able to master and analyze polysemia w/ no remainder

WM.content: dividing essence from proper permits the play of metaphor, doesn’t involve thing itself in play of substitutions, metaphor is mediate, abstract, medium of quasi-synonymy
WM.linkedContent: dividing essence from proper permits the play of metaphor, doesn’t involve thing itself in play of substitutions, metaphor is mediate, abstract, medium of quasi-synonymy

WM.content: antikatēgoreisthai: reciprocal substitution of two predicates related to identical concrete subject
WM.linkedContent: antikatēgoreisthai: reciprocal substitution of two predicates related to identical concrete subject

WM.content: first example of antikatēgoreisthai is grammar, i.e. what is proper to man is grammar, ability to read & write > belongs to chain of what’s proper to man: logos, phōnē sēmantikē, mimēsis, metaphora
WM.linkedContent: first example of antikatēgoreisthai is grammar, i.e. what is proper to man is grammar, ability to read & write > belongs to chain of what’s proper to man: logos, phōnē sēmantikē, mimēsis, metaphora

WM.content: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]
WM.linkedContent: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]

OS.content: Heidegger’s question of Being seeks to destroy vulgar concept of time by repeating and interrogating it > that Being is ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit w/ regard to idea of time as Gegenwart (the present)
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question of Being seeks to destroy vulgar concept of time by repeating and interrogating it > that Being is ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit w/ regard to idea of time as Gegenwart (the present)

OS.content: vulgar time as gegenwärtigen Besitze (always present possession), the having (Habe) of Being, its permanent presence
OS.linkedContent: vulgar time as gegenwärtigen Besitze (always present possession), the having (Habe) of Being, its permanent presence

OS.content: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude
OS.linkedContent: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude

ROP.content: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?
ROP.linkedContent: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?

SP.content: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability

SP.content: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation ——a singular limit, limit of being itself, not derivative of question of being, but also not available to investigation > onto-hermeneutic limitation shows chaque fois que surgit la question du propre in restricted fields (economy, linguistics, rhetoric, psychoanalysis, politics)
SP.linkedContent: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation ——a singular limit, limit of being itself, not derivative of question of being, but also not available to investigation > onto-hermeneutic limitation shows chaque fois que surgit la question du propre in restricted fields (economy, linguistics, rhetoric, psychoanalysis, politics)

SP.content: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other

SP.content: once there’s valuation (valorisation) of the proper, it can never be interrupted, a permanency that is valuation itself > its necessity must be interrogated sans cesse [re: Heidegger]
SP.linkedContent: once there’s valuation (valorisation) of the proper, it can never be interrupted, a permanency that is valuation itself > its necessity must be interrogated sans cesse [re: Heidegger]

SP.content: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon
SP.linkedContent: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon

ATIA.content: if “dressing oneself,” clothing, is proper to man, it arrives w/ all the others: speech, reason, logos, history, laughing, mourning, burial, gift, the concept of the concept
ATIA.linkedContent: if “dressing oneself,” clothing, is proper to man, it arrives w/ all the others: speech, reason, logos, history, laughing, mourning, burial, gift, the concept of the concept

ATIA.content: disavowal of being seen by the animal [Derrida believes it has happened to Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, Kant] > jealous of, anxious about, what is proper to man
ATIA.linkedContent: disavowal of being seen by the animal [Derrida believes it has happened to Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, Kant] > jealous of, anxious about, what is proper to man

ATIA.content: the 2 falls of man, Prometheus/Adam, narrate (infinite) superiority over the animal: man’s property is unconditional & sacrificial
ATIA.linkedContent: the 2 falls of man, Prometheus/Adam, narrate (infinite) superiority over the animal: man’s property is unconditional & sacrificial

ATIA.content: even in the superiority of the proper of man, his property is to have nothing proper to him
ATIA.linkedContent: even in the superiority of the proper of man, his property is to have nothing proper to him

ATIA.content: comparing Genesis w/ Greek myths [re: fault, nakedness] as two symptomatic translations, whose internal necessities partially overlap re: the proper of man [default in propriety]: technics, sociality, emergence out of nature, knowledge, historicity [?], subjectivity, subjugating superiority over animal
ATIA.linkedContent: comparing Genesis w/ Greek myths [re: fault, nakedness] as two symptomatic translations, whose internal necessities partially overlap re: the proper of man [default in propriety]: technics, sociality, emergence out of nature, knowledge, historicity [?], subjectivity, subjugating superiority over animal

PS.content: metaphysical determination of madness as disease of alienation had to be contemporary w/ proprius [Latin era] > proper subject, absolutely close to himself
PS.linkedContent: metaphysical determination of madness as disease of alienation had to be contemporary w/ proprius [Latin era] > proper subject, absolutely close to himself

PS.content: Artaud wants absolute restoration of proper to eve prior to all dissociation
PS.linkedContent: Artaud wants absolute restoration of proper to eve prior to all dissociation

PS.content: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]
PS.linkedContent: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]

PS.content: Artaud sometimes writes like Marx of 1844 Manuscripts: alienation & property
PS.linkedContent: Artaud sometimes writes like Marx of 1844 Manuscripts: alienation & property

SW.content: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let
SW.linkedContent: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let

DPi.content: for Hugo, inviolability of human life—an inalienable property > right of property over one’s own life no less sacred than patrimonial right of family (domicile as right of property)
DPi.linkedContent: for Hugo, inviolability of human life—an inalienable property > right of property over one’s own life no less sacred than patrimonial right of family (domicile as right of property)

RGE.content: Bataille: “keep in one hand what the other gives” (to possess ruins is not to possess nothing)
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille: “keep in one hand what the other gives” (to possess ruins is not to possess nothing)

Gii.content: hand is monstrosité (monstrasity), proper characteristic of man as the being of monstration
Gii.linkedContent: hand is monstrosité (monstrasity), proper characteristic of man as the being of monstration

Gii.content: “can’t talk about hand w/out talking about technology” [Derrida has just recalled photographs of Heidegger’s hands, way the hands seem deliberately staged, overflow the frame]
Gii.linkedContent: “can’t talk about hand w/out talking about technology” [Derrida has just recalled photographs of Heidegger’s hands, way the hands seem deliberately staged, overflow the frame]

Gii.content: Heidegger: man does not have hands, the hand has essence of man w/in it [p. 50 it is the hand that has man]
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: man does not have hands, the hand has essence of man w/in it [p. 50 it is the hand that has man]

REST.content: the pair (of shoes) might not come back to anyone: disappoint desire to reattribute surplus value > might have been made to “remain” there, defying the tribute
REST.linkedContent: the pair (of shoes) might not come back to anyone: disappoint desire to reattribute surplus value > might have been made to “remain” there, defying the tribute

REST.content: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)
REST.linkedContent: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)

REST.content: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”
REST.linkedContent: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”

REST.content: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly
REST.linkedContent: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing

PIO.content: btwn 17th-19th centuries, in the positive notion of rights, only form & composition display invention/originality—not content, “things,” thematics or meaning
PIO.linkedContent: btwn 17th-19th centuries, in the positive notion of rights, only form & composition display invention/originality—not content, “things,” thematics or meaning

PIO.content: universality (ideal objectivity, unlimited recurrence) in invention blurs signature of invention: name of individual (singular empirical entity) is associated w/ invention in inessential, extrinsic, accidental, aleatory way > this gives rise to enormous problem of property rights
PIO.linkedContent: universality (ideal objectivity, unlimited recurrence) in invention blurs signature of invention: name of individual (singular empirical entity) is associated w/ invention in inessential, extrinsic, accidental, aleatory way > this gives rise to enormous problem of property rights

TR.content: violence of “I”: irreducibly singular, yet nothing more universal, anonymous
TR.linkedContent: violence of “I”: irreducibly singular, yet nothing more universal, anonymous

TR.content: w/ reference to unjust justice [phrase Derrida admits having stolen from de Man], where the law suspends reference right as it requires it, where chacun, “each one,” is appropriated (always theft/deceit) in utterance “I” > all justice begins in perjury
TR.linkedContent: w/ reference to unjust justice [phrase Derrida admits having stolen from de Man], where the law suspends reference right as it requires it, where chacun, “each one,” is appropriated (always theft/deceit) in utterance “I” > all justice begins in perjury

TR.content: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury
TR.linkedContent: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury

TR.content: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”:  one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”: one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man

TR.content: materiality: useful name for that which resists appropriation
TR.linkedContent: materiality: useful name for that which resists appropriation

TR.content: de Man: nothing legitimate about property, but rhetoric of property confers illusion of legitimacy
TR.linkedContent: de Man: nothing legitimate about property, but rhetoric of property confers illusion of legitimacy

TR.content: event is radically inappropriable, radically resistant to logic of proper
TR.linkedContent: event is radically inappropriable, radically resistant to logic of proper

AFR.content: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself
AFR.linkedContent: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself

AFR.content: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself
AFR.linkedContent: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself

AFR.content: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”

PSSS.content: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)
PSSS.linkedContent: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)

D.content: authority & property still remain, but as pretensions of attending discourse, dead surface effects
D.linkedContent: authority & property still remain, but as pretensions of attending discourse, dead surface effects

D.content: one’s undifferentiated proximity to oneself: another name for death > the space of property: “dead surface”
D.linkedContent: one’s undifferentiated proximity to oneself: another name for death > the space of property: “dead surface”

HST.content: stranger is a digression that risks corrupting proximity to self of the proper
HST.linkedContent: stranger is a digression that risks corrupting proximity to self of the proper

C.content: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful
C.linkedContent: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful

C.content: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable
C.linkedContent: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable

C.content: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)
C.linkedContent: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)

LI.content: economics that accounts for iterability, which questions traditional philosophy of oikos, of propre > can’t be separate from economy of Unconscious, of graphematics of undecidables
LI.linkedContent: economics that accounts for iterability, which questions traditional philosophy of oikos, of propre > can’t be separate from economy of Unconscious, of graphematics of undecidables

LI.content: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event
LI.linkedContent: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event

LI.content: to have a general theory of speech act theory: masterpiece of metaphysical-oedipal rhetoric
LI.linkedContent: to have a general theory of speech act theory: masterpiece of metaphysical-oedipal rhetoric

LI.content: deconstructions are movements of “exappropriation” > is a system (i.e. university) that appropriates it (i.e. deconstructive style) modified by this appropriation?
LI.linkedContent: deconstructions are movements of “exappropriation” > is a system (i.e. university) that appropriates it (i.e. deconstructive style) modified by this appropriation?

TN.content: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)
TN.linkedContent: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)

TN.content: “Tiens!”: that the other grasp or seize, keep what one extends to him, giving to “touch”
TN.linkedContent: “Tiens!”: that the other grasp or seize, keep what one extends to him, giving to “touch”

TN.content: touch gives nearness/proximity more than sight/hearing > proximity, proper, present
TN.linkedContent: touch gives nearness/proximity more than sight/hearing > proximity, proper, present

TN.content: one thinks first of all, and too much, of hands: take the gift (“Tiens!”), comprehension, prehension, captation, a plea (prière) > “tender extending” becomes violence itself: “Take that!”
TN.linkedContent: one thinks first of all, and too much, of hands: take the gift (“Tiens!”), comprehension, prehension, captation, a plea (prière) > “tender extending” becomes violence itself: “Take that!”

TN.content: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?
TN.linkedContent: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?

TN.content: touch more proper (Berkeley, Aristotle, Husserl, Maine de Biran)

proper, ipseity, proche, “same” are all deconstructible [but try to speak w/out them!], beyond their pedagogical and rhetorical necessity, what do they ever mean? the law that hatches irresistible desire of appropriation (“my body,” “here”) destines it to expropriation > this desire handed over to promise of expropriation [Derrida is deconstructing Nancy’s “properly”]
TN.linkedContent: proper, ipseity, proche, “same” are all deconstructible [but try to speak w/out them!], beyond their pedagogical and rhetorical necessity, what do they ever mean? the law that hatches irresistible desire of appropriation (“my body,” “here”) destines it to expropriation > this desire handed over to promise of expropriation [Derrida is deconstructing Nancy’s “properly”]

ATM.content: “je donne, je joue l’ingratitude contre la jalousie,” if God is exempt from jealousy (no desire for possession) must he not guard this exemption jealously, and in so doing lose himself? > ellipse de jalousie: le sans-jalousie se garde jalousement, autrement dit se perd, se-garde-se-perd: plus de jalousie [seriasure always a jealous, series of traits & retraits, beyond the face]
ATM.linkedContent: “je donne, je joue l’ingratitude contre la jalousie,” if God is exempt from jealousy (no desire for possession) must he not guard this exemption jealously, and in so doing lose himself? > ellipse de jalousie: le sans-jalousie se garde jalousement, autrement dit se perd, se-garde-se-perd: plus de jalousie [seriasure always a jealous, series of traits & retraits, beyond the face]

EW.content: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man
EW.linkedContent: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man

BSi.content: what is proper to man isn’t > look closer
BSi.linkedContent: what is proper to man isn’t > look closer

BSi.content: sovereign: he, himself, ipse; beast: she, tamed (mastered) > suspension of pendulum is double
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign: he, himself, ipse; beast: she, tamed (mastered) > suspension of pendulum is double

BSi.content: potsedere (possess), potest, possum (power, “I can”) > ipse (self & power) > Benveniste thinks etymological shift from power (despotēs) to himself (ipse) enfeebles, not Derrida
BSi.linkedContent: potsedere (possess), potest, possum (power, “I can”) > ipse (self & power) > Benveniste thinks etymological shift from power (despotēs) to himself (ipse) enfeebles, not Derrida

BSi.content: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
BSi.linkedContent: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)

BSi.content: what is proper to man throws certain [Nation-State] sovereignty into crisis
BSi.linkedContent: what is proper to man throws certain [Nation-State] sovereignty into crisis

BSi.content: if bêtise is proper to man, autopositing the proper is stupidity itself
BSi.linkedContent: if bêtise is proper to man, autopositing the proper is stupidity itself

BSi.content: accusation of bête deprives the accused, like animal, of all that is proper to man (language, reason, logos, sense of death, technique, history, convention, culture, laughter, tears, work)
BSi.linkedContent: accusation of bête deprives the accused, like animal, of all that is proper to man (language, reason, logos, sense of death, technique, history, convention, culture, laughter, tears, work)

BSi.content: if phallus is proper to sovereign, is it proper to man?
BSi.linkedContent: if phallus is proper to sovereign, is it proper to man?

BSi.content: Heidegger’s problem w/ zōon logon ekhon, it’s “zoological,” late-on-the-scene, does not question the essence of life
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger’s problem w/ zōon logon ekhon, it’s “zoological,” late-on-the-scene, does not question the essence of life

BSi.content: Heidegger doesn’t say “there’s nothing proper to man,” but that the property of what is appropriated is strange, unfamiliar to interior of home
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger doesn’t say “there’s nothing proper to man,” but that the property of what is appropriated is strange, unfamiliar to interior of home

BSi.content: knowledge no stranger to power, power no stranger to seeing, having, willing > autopsic/autoptic knowledge: take power over object of knowledge
BSi.linkedContent: knowledge no stranger to power, power no stranger to seeing, having, willing > autopsic/autoptic knowledge: take power over object of knowledge

OG.content: absolute knowledge effaces writing in logos, it is the retrieval (résumption) of trace in parousia, the metaphysics of the proper, reappropriation of difference
OG.linkedContent: absolute knowledge effaces writing in logos, it is the retrieval (résumption) of trace in parousia, the metaphysics of the proper, reappropriation of difference

OG.content: nonprohibition of proper name as consciousness which restitutes or discovers irremediable impropriety of proper names
OG.linkedContent: nonprohibition of proper name as consciousness which restitutes or discovers irremediable impropriety of proper names

OG.content: Rousseau looks for a supplement to take complete possession of his heart (remplit mon coeur) > a substitute for mother (another girl)
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau looks for a supplement to take complete possession of his heart (remplit mon coeur) > a substitute for mother (another girl)

OG.content: this sequence of supplements announces necessity of an infinite chain of substitutes: immediacy is derived > that’s what’s inconceivable to reason
OG.linkedContent: this sequence of supplements announces necessity of an infinite chain of substitutes: immediacy is derived > that’s what’s inconceivable to reason

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, “moral love” not biology but power of imagination > all depravity of culture related to possession of women (movement of preference/difference)
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, “moral love” not biology but power of imagination > all depravity of culture related to possession of women (movement of preference/difference)

OG.content: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)
OG.linkedContent: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, absolutely literal (propre) is at origin, the proper name, one sign per thing, one represented per passion
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, absolutely literal (propre) is at origin, the proper name, one sign per thing, one represented per passion

OG.content: proper names born in tandem w/ verbs (infinitive present) > degradation in their separation
OG.linkedContent: proper names born in tandem w/ verbs (infinitive present) > degradation in their separation

OG.content: for Rousseau, in writing the worst is simultaneously the best: total alienation is total reappropriation of presence to itself > Rousseau: “plus de force pour conserver ce qu’on a”
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, in writing the worst is simultaneously the best: total alienation is total reappropriation of presence to itself > Rousseau: “plus de force pour conserver ce qu’on a”

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter

ATAP.content: [quoted from GLAS p. 198 (222)] absolute knowledge as phantasm of absolute self-having (s’avoir absolu), to be(come) (être-devenir), in a word, bander (bind, bandage, hard-on), son propre mors [Nietzsche’s “become hard”] [cf. CIN pp. 56-8 swallow another to speak his/her commands]
ATAP.linkedContent: [quoted from GLAS p. 198 (222)] absolute knowledge as phantasm of absolute self-having (s’avoir absolu), to be(come) (être-devenir), in a word, bander (bind, bandage, hard-on), son propre mors [Nietzsche’s “become hard”] [cf. CIN pp. 56-8 swallow another to speak his/her commands]

EU.content: never in possession of it, inaccessible, essence of philosophy excludes teaching, essence of philosophizing demands it
EU.linkedContent: never in possession of it, inaccessible, essence of philosophy excludes teaching, essence of philosophizing demands it

SPEC.content: [re: Ernst’s fort/da] double sending away (renvoi): whether father required to stay or go, mother is desired: “exclusive possession” [Freud & Ernst distance themselves from name of father, for Freud it is the name of the son-in-law]
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Ernst’s fort/da] double sending away (renvoi): whether father required to stay or go, mother is desired: “exclusive possession” [Freud & Ernst distance themselves from name of father, for Freud it is the name of the son-in-law]

SPEC.content: mother (woman) easier to possess/preserve when dead [?]—jealousy appeased
SPEC.linkedContent: mother (woman) easier to possess/preserve when dead [?]—jealousy appeased

SPEC.content: [vis-à-vis Freud] pas de plus > deux temps of drive: 1) conserves 2) insures path to death, pas de mort, organism arrives by its own (internal) step at death (eigenen Todesweg): s’envoyer the message of one’s own death
SPEC.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Freud] pas de plus > deux temps of drive: 1) conserves 2) insures path to death, pas de mort, organism arrives by its own (internal) step at death (eigenen Todesweg): s’envoyer the message of one’s own death

SPEC.content: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death
SPEC.linkedContent: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death

SPEC.content: [Freud’s death drive] autoteleguiding, suicide deferred, wishes to sound its own glas, wishes the impossible > most driven drive is drive of the proper, drive to reappropriate oneself, stronger than life & death
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud’s death drive] autoteleguiding, suicide deferred, wishes to sound its own glas, wishes the impossible > most driven drive is drive of the proper, drive to reappropriate oneself, stronger than life & death

SPEC.content: but S is never P, since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper
SPEC.linkedContent: but S is never P, since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper

SPEC.content: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]
SPEC.linkedContent: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]

SPEC.content: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?
SPEC.linkedContent: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?

SPEC.content: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance

SPEC.content: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”
SPEC.linkedContent: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”

SPEC.content: Freud wonders if calling death immanent & proper to life functions as a great narrative poem, a poetics of proper as reconciliation? consolation? (make it more bearable as Anankē)
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud wonders if calling death immanent & proper to life functions as a great narrative poem, a poetics of proper as reconciliation? consolation? (make it more bearable as Anankē)

SPEC.content: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP,  proper produced as autothanatography
SPEC.linkedContent: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP, proper produced as autothanatography

FV.content: for Lacan, letter is held—never possessed

Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented
FV.linkedContent: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented

FV.content: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it
FV.linkedContent: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it

FV.content: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body
FV.linkedContent: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body

FV.content: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)
FV.linkedContent: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)

FV.content: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)

FV.content: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program
FV.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program

FV.content: full speech, contracts only w/ itself, system of truth > Lacan not proposing crude readjustment [i.e. American psychology] but rarity à la Heideggerian Eigentlichkeit
FV.linkedContent: full speech, contracts only w/ itself, system of truth > Lacan not proposing crude readjustment [i.e. American psychology] but rarity à la Heideggerian Eigentlichkeit

CHOR.content: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture

CHOR.content: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
CHOR.linkedContent: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
